segment.source: How to Uninstall the App-V Client
segment.target: How to Uninstall the App-V Client

segment.source: How to Uninstall the App-V Client
segment.target: How to Uninstall the App-V Client

segment.source: How to Uninstall the App-V Client
segment.target: How to Uninstall the App-V Client

segment.source: Use the following procedure to uninstall the Application Virtualization Client from the computer.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to uninstall the Application Virtualization Client from the computer.

segment.source: To uninstall the Application Virtualization Desktop Client
segment.target: To uninstall the Application Virtualization Desktop Client

segment.source: In Control Panel, double-click Add or Remove Programs (or in Windows Vista, Programs and Features), and then double-click Microsoft Application Virtualization Desktop Client.
segment.target: In Control Panel, double-click Add or Remove Programs (or in Windows Vista, Programs and Features), and then double-click Microsoft Application Virtualization Desktop Client.

segment.source: In the dialog box that appears, click Yes to continue with the uninstall process.
segment.target: In the dialog box that appears, click Yes to continue with the uninstall process.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: The uninstall process cannot be canceled or interrupted.
segment.target: The uninstall process cannot be canceled or interrupted.

segment.source: When a message stating that the Microsoft Application Virtualization Client Tray application must be closed before continuing appears, right-click the App-V icon in the notification area and select Exit to close the application.
segment.target: When a message stating that the Microsoft Application Virtualization Client Tray application must be closed before continuing appears, right-click the App-V icon in the notification area and select Exit to close the application.

segment.source: Then click Retry to continue with the uninstall process.
segment.target: Then click Retry to continue with the uninstall process.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: You might see a message stating that one or more virtual applications are in use.
segment.target: You might see a message stating that one or more virtual applications are in use.

segment.source: Close any open applications and save your data before you continue.
segment.target: Close any open applications and save your data before you continue.

segment.source: Then click OK to continue with the uninstall process.
segment.target: Then click OK to continue with the uninstall process.

segment.source: A progress bar shows the time remaining.
segment.target: A progress bar shows the time remaining.

segment.source: When this step finishes, you must restart the computer so that all associated drivers can be stopped to complete the uninstall process.
segment.target: When this step finishes, you must restart the computer so that all associated drivers can be stopped to complete the uninstall process.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The following registry keys remain after the uninstall process is complete:
segment.target: The following registry keys remain after the uninstall process is complete:

segment.source: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeMicrosoftSoftGrid
segment.target: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeMicrosoftSoftGrid

segment.source: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeMicrosoftSoftGrid4.5
segment.target: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeMicrosoftSoftGrid4.5

segment.source: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeMicrosoftSoftGrid4.5SystemGuard "Client"=dword:00000000
segment.target: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeMicrosoftSoftGrid4.5SystemGuard "Client"=dword:00000000

segment.source: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeMicrosoftSoftGrid4.5SystemGuardSecKey
segment.target: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeMicrosoftSoftGrid4.5SystemGuardSecKey
